Authors: Hiroshi Masumoto, Yousuke Degawa, Shinji Handa
Title:
Elliptochloris, not Coccomyxa, is the photobiont of three
lichenized Multiclavula species collected in Japan
Keywords:
basidiolichen, Cantharellales, Coccomyxa, Elliptochloris,
Multiclavula, new species, TEM, Trebouxiophyceae
Abstract:
Approximately 20 000 species of lichenized fungi are
currently recognized, whereas the diversity of their photobionts is much
less well known. In this study, the photobionts of three Multiclavula
species (M. mucida, M. petricola, and M. vernalis) collected in Japan
were isolated and cultured, and identified using light microscopy, TEM,
and molecular sequence analyses. Previously, identifications of the
photobionts associated with Multiclavula have centered on Coccomyxa. In
our material, we found instead that the photobiont of M. mucida is
Elliptochloris subsphaerica, and that of M. petricola and M. vernalis is
a new species, described herein as Elliptochloris parasphaerica. This is
the first report of Elliptochloris as a photobiont of lichenized
basidiomycetes. In the phylogenetic analysis of rbcL+18S rDNA, E.
subsphaerica was composed of six subclades, and M. mucida showed a
strong tendency to select one specific subclade for the photobiont.
